climbs.name: Hap
climbs.fa: Gabe Hagan, Austin Cooner, Margaret Weingart

content.description:
This is an excellent multipitch climb up the west face of Exemplar Tower.

Pitch 1: scramble up easy terrain to a hand crack/face climb. Set up a belay on a semi-ledge that fits about 3 people.

Pitch 2: from the ledge, move up on the finger crack/face climb and use the left arete for help. Then trend right for more fun climbing, and boulder the blocks at the top of the tower.
content.protection: There is good protection throughout. A standard rack works fine. Tape up!
content.location: It is on the far north side of the west face of the tower (GPS coordinates are approximately 39.00291, -104.91231). From the approach trail, go up the rough creekbed until you hit the west face. The start is next to a tree at the base of the first dihedral that continues up the tower.

content.description: This is a pretty easy crack system with a crossover crux when trending left to the upper crack.
content.protection:
A standard rack, you can toprope off the top spire.

There is a bolted anchor with rap rings at the top.
content.location:
Start next to a tree on top of the mossy detached block to the right of

Wilbur

. Located on the East side of the North face at approx. (39.00299, -104.91180)

content.description:
This is quality crack and face climbing. Start the same as

Orville

, but follow the left-facing corner and trend to the right upper crack system ending on a small pinnacle.
content.protection: Solid gear in the 1.5-2 range. There is a bolted anchor with rap rings at the top.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Orville

, then above trend right. Located on the East side of the North face at approx. (39.00299, -104.91180)

content.description: Thor follows a crack between a North-facing and West-facing slab. It tops out on a zig-zag crack on the North-facing slab.
content.protection: A standard rack. You can also sling a boulder at the top of the route.
content.location: Thor is on the West-facing side of Exemplar Tower. The route is located at GPS coordinates 39.00278, -104.91227.

content.description: This funky crack/face climb navigates the greenish section of the tower on the far left. Start in the corner, then go up the vertical crack to a section of face. The climb finishes on the crack that separates a detached block at the top.
content.protection: Solid camming in the 1.5-2 range. There is a bolted anchor with rap rings at the top.
content.location: It is the furthest left route on the Tower. Located on the East side of the North face at approx. (39.00299, -104.91180)

content.description: The first pitch follows the main crack up a dihedral between the black and red/green rock faces. There is a set of bolts above a ledge with enough space for two people. The second pitch is directly above the first set of bolts. There is a bolted anchor at the top of the route.
content.protection: Two bolted anchors with rappel rings. The route was bolted by Ben Roberts, Trey Walker, and Hayden Richards.
content.location:
Curt's Crack is located on the North face of Exemplar Tower at GPS coordinates 39.00309, -104.91198.

See the Exemplar Tower map for all route locations.
